paper_metadata.title: Increased prevalence of the founder BRCA1 c.5309G>T and recurrent BRCA2 c.1310_1313delAAGA mutations in breast cancer families from Northerstern region of Morocco: evidence of geographical specificity and high relevance for genetic counseling
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports on the BRCA2 variant c.1310_1313delAAGA, detailing its prevalence, clinical significance, and penetrance data among breast cancer patients in Northeastern Morocco.

patients.demographics: female breast cancer patients from Northeastern Morocco

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The average of age at diagnosis in patients with c.1310_1313delAAGA mutation was 41 years.

functional_data.summary: The c.1310_1313delAAGA mutation is associated with breast cancer in the studied population.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation was also encountered in two patients among four BC males.
key_quotes: The screening of BRCA1/2 genes by NGS sequencing confirmed that there are no additional mutations detected among the mutation carrier patients.
In total, we identified 12 females (7.35%) carrying BRCA2 c.1310_1313 DelAAGA mutation.

tables_processed.table_caption: Comparison of clinicopathological features between familial and sporadic patients groups
Clinical and pathological characteristics of BRCA1 c.5309G>T and BRCA2 c.1310_1313 DelAAGA mutation carriers in Moroccan population

extraction_metadata.notes: Data extraction was straightforward with clear reporting of the BRCA2 variant.
